(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item scholar's pack|phb}

fluff.name: The Inkmagus
entries: A bald human, covered head to toe in black, geomteric tattoos, meditates upon a pillar. He remains motionless, the wind swirling about ruffling his clothes yet seemingly leaving him untouched. In a moment, he opens his eyes, and begins to descend a new vision set in his heart for the future of the world.

A forest gnome, her skin dappled with ink like the shadows of a forest, moves silently through the trees, crossing a glade before disappearing again the moment she enters folliage.When she reaches the orc hunting party, she suddenly leaps forward in a bust of action, whirling blades shrieking out of the trees.

A half-elven gambler sits at the table, the forearms poking out from his sleeves marked with four-leaved clovers and six- sided dice amongst flowing black lines. The duergar gather around expecting this new comer to lose everything as the fate of the captives comes down to a single die roll The die seems about to settle, then suddenly rolls on, landing with two sixes and guaranteeing the half-elf his victory. As the dwarves rage and shout in disbelief, a slight smile tweaks the half-elf’s lips.

These individuals are radically different in many ways, but each is tied to the others by one thing: they are defined above all, by the magical tattoos they bear. More than simply decoration, these powerful tattoos imbue the wearer with magical powers, revealing mysteries, filling the body with arush of adrenaline, or even banding chance in your favour.

This is the mark of the inkmagus, a magic-wielder who drawsupon the power of mystical tattoos.Different inkmagi draw their power from different sources: some from the life force that pulses through all creation, others from ancestor spirits, some from divine meditation, some from the magic of the Weave. For every inkmagus, whatever the source of their power, this power is channeled and controlled through tattoos with magical force

entries.name: Colour and Vibrancy
entries: For those who follow the path of the inkmagus, their own body becomes a work of art, to be built upon and developed over the course of a lifetime. As an inkmagus, your skin is your canvas, and you express your identity and values through the style and pattern of tattoos you bear.

inkmagi have an eye for colour and form, and usually try to design their tattoos in such a way as to both exacerbate the features they find aesthetically pleasing in their own form and to abstract away from their physical body to present an image which is broader and larger than just their own four limbs.

Wherever this class provides a description for a tattoo, this is intended as a launching platform and an inspiration, not as a prescription. Although the tattoos detailed below are those widely developed by inkmagi, each inkmagus will have their own interpretation of the correct colour, shape, and form of every tattoo, which both captures the universal imagery of the tattoos and simultaneously expresses their individuality and personality.

entries.name: Every Mark has a Story
entries: For an inkmagus, no two tattoos are the same, and every tattoo has a story to tell As an inkmagus, the tattoos you choose should reflect your character’s history and trajectory, the people and places they have encountered in life, and the lessons they have learned.

When you choose your early tattoos, consider how they reflect your character’s history and ideals, the things and people that really matter to them. As you continue on your adventures, you may find that the content of those adventures begin to inform the tattoos you choose, such as choosing a tattoo to comemorate a recently fallen comrade, or a particular grand adventure.
While you do not need to tell the stories of every tattoo you have, try to at least have a vague idea of what each tattoo means to your character, and the story they could tell

entries.name: Creating an Inkmagus
entries: As you create your inkmagus, two major questions should guide your design: who taught you the art of crafting magic tattoos, and how connected are you with the ancient traditions?

Most inkmagi train under a master. Did you train under an established master with many pupils? Perhaps your master was a lone wanderer, driven away as a heretic for his unusual take on inkmagus traditions. Or perhaps you developed your techniques yourself, either from instructional tomes or by a stroke of inspiration. If you had a mentor, you should determine what your relationship with them was like, and why you left.

Related to your mentor is your connection with the ancient traditions. The art of magical tattoos is founded in a tradition filled with complex rituals and intricate symbolsim, handed down from master to apprentice over many generations.

classFeature.name: Imagry
entries: You are adapt with expressing meaning through complex symbolism and imagery, which functions like a second language to you. When you paint or sketch a picture, you can encode in that picture a short hidden message, up to a few sentences long.

You and other creatures who know this picture language can see and understand any such message in a picture. Other creatures that do not know this language can spot the message with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (History) check related to art history, but they can’t decipher it without magic.

classFeature.name: Inkcasting
entries: Your body is covered with a number of powerful tattoos, drawn on your skin as part of an ancient ritual and imbued with magical power, which you can draw upon to produce magical effects.
Inkcasting follows the general rules of spellcasting unless otherwise stated, as found in the Player’s Handbook.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: Your body is marked with a number of smaller tattoos that can be invoked at will to produce simple magic effects. Each tattoo is tied to a single cantrip, which you can invoke the tattoo to produce.

You start with two cantrip tattoos of your choice. Choose two cantrips from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}. You gain a tattoo associated with each cantrip, and you can cast those cantrips from your tattoos. (This counts as knowing those cantrips).
You gain an additional cantrip tattoo at 4th level, and a further cantrip tattoo at 10th level

entries.name: Personal Ink
entries: You do not know or prepare spells of 1st level or higher, as other classes do. Instead, your body is marked with a number of magical inks, which either provide perpetual magical protection or can be invoked to produce magical effects.

You start with two inks. Choose your ink from the {@filter inks options|feats|source=inkmagusreeditedanna}. You can only choose an ink for which you fulfil the prerequisites. You gain additional inks at higher levels, as specified in the “personal ink” column of the Inkmagus table.

entries.name: Arcane Needle
entries: you create an Arcane Needle, a ﬁnely tuned tool that allows you to etch beautiful art on people’s skin, You can now create magical tattoos of {@filter Common|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=common|category=} rarity. to create a magical tattoo you must learn how to imbue a mundane tattoo with magical energy, the amount of magical tattoos you know each day is specified in the “Tattoos Known” column of the Inkmagus table.

Each dawn, pick a number of tattoos equal to your “Tattoos Known” amount from the {@filter magical tattoo list|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=wondrous item;tattoo|category=} and add them to your list of tattoos known.

entries.name: Tattoos Known
entries: it is recommanded to have a regular list of known tattoos with general benefits and replace them if theres a better tattoo for the situation.
Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch a person with your arcane needle and mark them with one of your tattoos, turning it into a magic tattoo.
Your magic tattoo remains on a person indefinitely, but when you die, the magical tattoo vanishes after a number of days have passed equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 day).

You can tattoo more than one person at the end of a long rest; the maximum number of magical tattoos you can have on others appears in the “tattoo slots” column of the Inkmagus table. You must touch each of them with the arcane needle, and each of your tattoos can be only on one person at a time. If you try to exceed your maximum number of tattoos, the oldest tattoo immediately vanishes, and then the new tattoo applies.
additionally, you can mark your own skin with a {@filter Common|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=common|category=} magical tattoo without having to spend a tattoo slot.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your inkmagus spells, since your magic draws upon an intimate knowledge of the art form. You use your Intelligence modifier whenever spell or tattoo effects refer to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for an inkmagus spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: The tattoos on your body act as a spellcasting focus for your inkmagus spells.

classFeature.name: Channel Marks (1/rest)
entries: At 2nd level you gain the ability to channel mystical energies through your tattoos, using that energy to fuel magical effects.You start with one such effect: Stroke of Luck. Your inking tradition will grant you an additional effect at 3rd level and certain inking traditions may grant further effects at higher levels.
When you use your Channel Marks, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Marks again.
Some Channel Marks effects require saving throws. When you use an effect from this class, the DC equals to your inkmagus spell save DC.

Beginning at 6th level you can use your Channel Marks twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain all expended uses.

entries.name: Channel Marks: Stroke of Luck
entries: As a reaction when you fail an attack roll ability check, or saving throw, you can imbue your tattoos with mystical energy to grant yourself a blessing of fortune. Roll a d4 and add it to the d20 roll for that attack roll ability check, or saving throw, possibly changing the result.
As you increase your inkmagus level the die rolled increases in size, as shown in the Luck Die table.

classFeature.name: Channel Marks (2/rest)
entries: Beginning at 6th level you can use your Channel Marks twice between rests.

classFeature.name: Channel Marks (3/rest)
entries: beginning at 18th level you can use  your Channel Marks three times between rests.

classFeature.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: Starting at 2nd level your perception passes beyond the visible. As an action, you can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of you that is invisible or on the Ethereal Plane for the next minute, and you can pinpoint any such creature that is moving. As you do not know the size or shape of the creature, you still have disadvantage on attack rolls against it.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of once), and you regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ritual Painter (1st level)
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn to use art to invoke magical rituals. You learn one 1st level spell from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}, which you can cast as a ritual spell if you have a set of {@item Painter's Supplies|PHB} or {@item Inking supplies|InkmagusReEditedAnna} with you.

Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spells You gain additional rituals as you reach higher levels in this class. At 5th level you can learn one 2nd level spell from the inkmagus spell list. At 9th level you learn a 3rd level spell At 13th level you learn a 4th level spell Finally, at 17th level you can learn one 5th level spell Each of these spells you can cast as a ritual using this feature, just like the 1st level spell

classFeature.name: Ritual Painter (2nd level)
entries: You gain additional rituals as you reach higher levels in this class. At 5th level you can learn one 2nd level spell from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}.

classFeature.name: Ritual Painter (3rd level)
entries: You gain additional rituals as you reach higher levels in this class. At 9th level you can learn one 3rd level spell from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}.

classFeature.name: Ritual Painter (4th level)
entries: You gain additional rituals as you reach higher levels in this class. At 13th level you can learn one 4th level spell from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}.

classFeature.name: Ritual Painter (5th level)
entries: You gain additional rituals as you reach higher levels in this class. At 17th level you can learn one 5th level spell from the {@filter inkmagus spell list|spells|class=Inkmagus (TIM)}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level and again at 8th, 12th, 16th and 19th level you either:

items: increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 As normal you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
pick a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice you qualify for.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you either:

items: increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 As normal you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
pick a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice you qualify for.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level you either:

items: increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 As normal you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
pick a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice you qualify for.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level you either:

items: increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 As normal you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
pick a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice you qualify for.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level you can either:

items: increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1 As normal you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
pick a {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice you qualify for.

classFeature.name: Mark of the Stars
entries: At 18th level you develop a new tattoo which resembles interconnected stars and grants you an increased resilience. Choose one of the tattoos from the Constellation table. You gain proficiency in the saving throw associated with that tattoo.

classFeature.name: Living Canvass
entries: At 20th level your entire body becomes a malleable canvas on which you can work. You can cast the alter self spell on yourself at will Additionally, you gain the following Channel Marks feature.

entries.name: Channel Marks: Maleable Form
entries: As an action, you can imbue your tattoos with mystical energy to transform your entire being. cast the shapechange spell on yourself, without expending material components.

classFeature.name: Inking Specialization
entries: At 3rd level you choose an inking Inking Specialization whose principles and forms you will follow. Each Inking Specialization is detailed at the end of the class description. The Inking Specialization you choose grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 14th and 17th level

classFeature.name: Specialist feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inking Specialization.

classFeature.name: Specialist feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inking Specialization.

classFeature.name: Specialist feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inking Specialization.

classFeature.name: Specialist feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Inking Specialization.

subclassFeature.name: Tattoo Artist Specialist
entries: You have focused your efforts twards helping people with your skills and learned how to imbue your tattoos with more potent magical energy. you also discovered that your arcane needle can do more than just ink.

subclassFeature.name: Art in Violance
entries: When you adopt this specialty at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with light armor, Additionally you gain proficiency with the Sleight of Hand skill, Finally, you gain proficiency with Painter’s supplies.

subclassFeature.name: Tattoo Artist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Tattoo Artist Spells table. These spells count as Inkmagus spells for you, but they don’t count against the number of InkMagus spells you know

entries.caption: Tattoo Artist Spells
rows: {@spell Find Greater Steed|XGE}, {@spell Galder's Speedy Courier|LLK}

subclassFeature.name: Improved Arcane Needle
entries: Upon choosing this tradition at 3rd level, you can now etch tattoos of {@filter uncommon|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=uncommon|category=} rarity.

At 7th level you can etch {@filter Rare|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=rare|category=} tattos, at 11th level {@filter Very vare|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=very rare|category=} tattoos, and at 15th level {@filter Legendary|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=legendary|category=} tattoos. at your DMs discrettion you can expand on the options presented, and create your own tattoos with their own unique abilities.
Additionally, you can mark your own skin with an {@filter uncommon|items|source=inkmagusreeditedanna|type=tattoo|rarity=uncommon|category=} magical tattoo without having to spend a tattoo slot.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Marks: Rush of Battle
entries: Also at 3rd level you can imbue your tattoos with passion-filled energy to empower you to greater feats of strengh. For 1 minute you gain the following benefits:

items: Your AC increases by half your proficiency bonus (rounded down), as long as you are not wearing medium or heavy armour.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack using a ranged weapon or a weapon with the finesse property, you can deal an additional {@dice 1d6} damage with that attack.
Your base walking speed increases by 10 feet.

entries: When this effect on you ends, you are winded until the end of your next turn. While winded, your movement speed is halved, and you can’t take reactions.

subclassFeature.name: Steel Stinger
entries: At 6th level, you adopt your {@item arcane needle|InkmagusReEditedAnna|Arcane Needle} for more offensive purposes and it counts as a magical weapon for the porpuse of overcoming resistence and you are proficent with it. while in combat the needle floats around you and you can direct it to attack.

As an action you can make a melee or ranged spell attack with the arcane needle, when you do so use your intelligence modifier for the attack and damage, on a hit deal your {@table Luck Die|InkmagusReEditedAnna} type as piercing damage.

Additionally When you cast an Inkmagus spell through the stinger, roll your {@table Luck Die|InkmagusReEditedAnna}, and you gain bonus to one of the spell’s damage rolls equal to the number rolled. If the spell affects multiple creatures, one creature of your choice takes the bonus damage.

subclassFeature.name: Ink Barrier
entries: At 10th level as a bonus action, a creature bearing a magical tattoo created through your Arcane Needle can produce a magical barrier, gaining a number of temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier + half your Inkmagus level. Once a creature uses this ability, it cannot use it again until it finishes a long rest. additionally, you can mark your own skin with a rare magical tattoo without having to spend a tattoo slot.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Marks: Seal Spell
entries: At 10th level you can imbue your tattoos with mystic energy to capture enemy magic. When you or an ally within 10 feet are targeted by a spell with a level less than or equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1st level), you can use your reaction to expend one use of your Channel Marks to create a new, temporary tattoo on your body which duplicates that spell
You can invoke your new tattoo to cast the spell you duplicated, using your inkmagus spellcasting ability. Once you invoke the tattoo, the tattoo disappears.
You can only have up to three such tattoos at a time. Each tattoo lasts a number of days equal to your proficiency bonus, before fading if it has not been invoked.

subclassFeature.name: Mighty Brand
entries: At 14th level, a tattoo’s power grows whenever it is created through your peerless skill. A creature bearing a magical tattoo created through your Arcane Needle can use a tattoo’s active ability twice the usual amount.
Additionally, you can mark your own skin with a legendary magical tattoo without having to spend a tattoo slot.

subclassFeature.name: Mark of Blades
entries: At 17th level you develop a tattoo imbued with a spirit of war. Choose two of the following features:

entries.name: Rapid Assault
entries: You add your Intelligence modifier to Initiative checks.

entries.name: Cleaving Strike
entries: If you roll a 20 on your attack roll with a melee weapon against a creature, if you are not holding another weapon, you can make an additional attack against a different creature within your reach and within 5 feet of the target of your first attack.

entries.name: Steady Aim
entries: You can use a bonus action to steady your hands. If you do, any ranged weapon attack you make this turn deals an additional ld4 damage.

entries.name: Whirlwind Attack
entries: If you use your bonus action to make an offhand weapon attack, you can instead make two attacks with your offhand weapon as part of that bonus action.

item.name: Abyssal Whip Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts snaking shapes and patterns}

entries.name: Abyssal Elongation.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration, each of your melee weapon attacks on your turn can reach a target up to 15 feet away, as tendrils of ink launch from your weapon or unarmed strike toward the target.
Once used, this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bloodhound Tattto
entries: {@note This tattoo shows a unique symbol alongside a tiny arrow}

entries.name: Ink of Prey.
entries: As a bonus action, you can cause the symbol to launch at a creature you can see within 90 feet, forcing the creature to make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw.

On success, the tattoo returns to you. On failure, the creature is tattooed with the symbol for the next hour. For the duration, the arrow will point in the direction of the creature, changing in length to reflect the distance to the target. At the end of the duration, the tattoo reappears on your skin.
Once used, this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn

item.name: Cartoonist's Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo prominently cel-shades your skin.}

entries.name: Animation
entries: As a bonus action, you can shift the cel-shading to an adjacent part of your body

entries.name: Quick Sketch.
entries: As an action, you can force all creatures in a 20-foot radius to make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw.

On failure, a creature becomes boldly outlined for 1 minute. For the duration, attacks against an outlined creature have advantage if the attacker can see it, and the outlined creature can’t benefit from being invisible.
Once used, this action can't be used again until the next dawn

item.name: Dancing Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts a humanoid figure.}

entries.name: Performinks.
entries: As an action, you can empower this tattoo, causing the figure to dance or emote across your skin for 10 minutes.
Choose a number of humanoids who can see you, up to your Charisma modifier + level (minimum of one). Each humanoid makes a Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Performance) check.
On failure, the humanoid makes Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) checks with disadvantage for the duration.
Once used, this action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Eldritch Claw Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts clawlike forms and other jagged shapes along your wrists and hands.}
When making unarmed strikes, the ink physically manifests into dark claws, granting you a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls

item.name: Hawk Lock Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo coats your scalp with avian symbolry, such as feathers and wings.}

entries.name: Zero Ink.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute, causing the tattoo to shift down from your scalp and form a mask around your eyes, absorbing glare.
For the duration, your vision is enhanced, granting you bonuses on ranged attacks against targets at least 20 feet away. While you are in bright light, you gain +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While in dim light, you gain +1 to attack rolls.
At the end of the duration, the tattoo returns to your scalp, and this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn

item.name: Illuminatior's Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo contains beautiful calligraphy and images of writing implements. You can write with your fingertip as if it were an ink pen that never runs out of ink}

entries.name: Inkvisibility.
entries: As an action, you can touch a piece of writing up to one page in length and speak a creature’s name. The writing becomes invisible to everyone other than you and the named creature for the next 24 hours.
Either of you can dismiss the invisibility by touching the written script and willing the effect to end (no action required).
Once used, this action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Masquerade Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo appears on your skin as whatever you desire}

entries.name: Fluid Ink.
entries: As a bonus action, you can shape the tattoo into any color, pattern, or size (at least one inch wide) and move it to any area of your skin. It is always clearly a tattoo.

entries.name: Disguise Self
entries: As an action, you can use the tattoo to cast {@spell Disguise Self} with a spell save DC of 13.
Once the spell is cast from the tattoo, it can’t be cast from the tattoo again until the next dawn.

item.name: Prismtic Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo comprises all the colors of a rainbow}

entries.name: Tinktured Glow
entries: If the tattoo is exposed, as a bonus action, you can cause it to shed bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light in an additional 5-foot radius. You can end this effect again as a bonus action.

entries.name: Color Spray.
entries: As an action, you can use the tattoo to cast {@spell Color Spray}. Once the spell is cast from the tattoo, it can’t be cast from the tattoo again until the next dawn

item.name: Spellwrought Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo shows the script for the verbal component, the gestures for the somatic component, and a picture for the material component of a cantrip.}
While the tattoo is clear, you can cast this cantrip, and you cast without material components. The tattoo glows faintly for the cantrip's duration, after which the tattoo blears.

Between now and the next dawn, you can speak the name of any cantrip to the tattoo. At dawn, the tattoo clears to show the components for the specified cantrip. If no cantrip is specified, the tattoo shows the components of the previous day's cantrip.

item.name: Vision of Argus Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo covers its area with tight, interlocking eyes.}

entries.name: Diagnosis.
entries: As an action, you can touch a creature and empower the tattoo for 1 minute, causing the eyes to sweep across the creature's skin.
At the end of the duration, the tattoos return to their original positions and you learn what spells or diseases, if any, are currently affecting it.
Losing physical contact with the creature during the duration causes the tattoo to return prematurely, and you learn nothing.
Once used, this action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Writhing Grasp Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo has long intertwining designs}

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils.
entries: You can, as an action, cause the tattoo to extrude into inky tendrils, which reach for a creature you can see within 15 feet of you.
The creature must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or take {@dice 1d6} force damage and be {@condition grappled} by you.

As an action, the creature can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength {@skill (Athletics)} or Dexterity {@skill (Acrobatics)} check. The grapple also ends if you halt it (no action required) or if the creature is ever more than 15 feet away from you.
Once used, this action can't be used until the next dawn.

item.name: Wild Tattoo
entries: {@note this magic tattoo has a random design and enchantment every dawn.}

entries.name: Wild enchantment
entries: Roll on the {@table Minor Magical Properties|InkmagusReEditedAnna} table and the {@table Advantageous Enchantments|InkmagusReEditedAnna} table to find out what enchantments it has today

item.name: Angel Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note Angel tattoos harness divine magic and confer it on their owners. The powers of the tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Celestial Strikes.
entries: Your attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical weapons.

item.name: Bear Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a bear tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Bear Endurance.
entries: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

item.name: Chameleon Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a chameleon tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Chameleon Skin.
entries: As an action, you can cause your skin, and anything you're wearing, to change colour to match your environment. Provided you do not move more than 10 feet in a round, cast a prominent shadow, attack or cast a spell you become invisible to the naked eye.

item.name: Cobra Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a cobra tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Poison Defence.
entries: You gain advantage on saving throws against poison.

item.name: Dolphin Tattoo
entries: {@note }
You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and you can hold your breath for 20 minutes.

item.name: Dragon Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note Dragon tattoos tap into the magic of the mythical beasts. The powers of the tattoo aredetermined by its rarity and the colour of the ink, and rarer tattoos feature all the powers of less rare tattoos (with the exception that Twinned Draconic Strikes replaces Draconic Strikes).}

entries.name: Draconic Resilience.
entries: When you take damage of the type associated with your depicted dragon (determined by the colour of the tattoo's ink),
you can use your reaction to reduce that damage by 1d4 times your Proficiency bonus.

item.name: Eagle Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of an eagle tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Speed of the Eagle.
entries: Your walking speed increases by 5 feet.

item.name: Kingfisher Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a kingfisher tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Regal Presence.
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 1.

item.name: Mermaid Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a mermaid tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Amphibious.
entries: You can breathe air and water.

item.name: Monkey Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of the monkey tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Monkey Brain.
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 1.

item.name: Owl Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of an owl tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Owl's Intuition.
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

item.name: Panther Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a panther tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Panther Agility.
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

item.name: Phoenix Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a phoenix tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Protection of the Phoenix.
entries: The mark of the phoenix gives you immunity to the paralysed and petrified conditions.

item.name: Tiger Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a tiger tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Tiger Strength.
entries: Your Strength score increases by 1.

item.name: Unicorn Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a unicorn tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Celestial Shield.
entries: You can cast {@spell Shield of Faith|PHB}  on yourself, without components. Once used, this feature can't be used again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Wolf Tattoo (common)
entries: {@note The powers of a wolf tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Wild Instincts.
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

item.name: Angelwings Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts a pair of crossed white wings.}
As a bonus action while this tattoo is on your skin, you can cause white, angelic wings to sprout from your back for 1 minute.
While these wings are extended, you have a flying speed of 60 feet.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

item.name: Gambler's Friend Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo incorporates various gambling images, such as dice showing all sixes and lucky clovers.}
While it's on your skin, you gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws.

entries.name: Luck.
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you can call on its luck (no action required) to reroll one attack roll ability check, or saving throw you dislike. You must use the new roll.
Once used, this property can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Knifedancer Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a ring of daggers around your forearm.}
While it's on your skin, you can use a bonus action to create a {@item spectral dagger +1|InkmagusReEditedAnna|spectral dagger} in each hand for 1 minute, These daggers are magical.
for the duration attacks made with these daggers gain +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.
additonally,for the duration, if you throw the daggers they return to your hands at the end of your turn.
Once used, this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Barrier Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note this magic tattoo depicts protective imagery and uses ink that resembles liquid metal.}

entries.name: Protection.
entries: While you aren’t wearing armor, the tattoo grants you an Armor Class of 12 + your Dexterity modifier
You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

item.name: Eldritch Whip Tattoo
entries: {@note this magic tattoo depicts clawlike forms and other jagged shapes.}

entries.name: Magical Strike.
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming immunity and resistance to nonmagical attacks, and you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Eldritch Maul.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute. For the duration, each of your melee weapon attacks can reach a target up to 15 feet away from you, as inky tendrils launch from your weapon or unarmed strike toward the target.
In addition, your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 force damage on a hit.
Once used, this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Coiling Grasp Tattoo
entries: {@note this magic tattoo has long intertwining s designs.}

entries.name: Grasping Tendrils.
entries: While the tattoo is on your skin, you can, as an action, cause the tattoo to extrude into inky tendrils, which reach for a creature you can see within 15 feet of you.

The creature must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or take 3d6 force damage and be grappled by you. As an action, the creature can escape the grapple by succeeding on a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check.
The grapple also ends if you halt it (no action required), if the creature is ever more than 15 feet away from you, or if you use this tattoo on a different creature.
Once used, this action can't be used until the next dawn.

item.name: Container Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts an object of size Small or Tiny.}

entries.name: Store.
entries: As an action, you can touch an instance of the object to the tattoo, causing inky vines to absorb it into the skin. Up to 12 objects of the same type can be stored this way.
As a bonus action, you can pull a stored item from the tattoo.

item.name: Ghastly Gaze Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo contains symbols of pain and agony.}

entries.name: Inktimidate.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute, causing the tattoo to bulge and contract menacingly.
For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks and disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks against any target that can see you.
Once used, this bonus action can’t be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Hold Person.
entries: As an action, you can use the tattoo to cast {@spell Hold Person} with a spell save DC of 14.
Once the spell is cast from the tattoo, it can’t be cast from the tattoo again until the next dawn.

item.name: Improved Hawk Lock Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo depicts avian imagery, such as feathers, beaks, and wings, flowing over your scalp and down neck.}

entries.name: Zero Ink.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo for 1 minute, causing the tattoo to shift down from your scalp and form a mask around your eyes, absorbing glare.
For the duration, your vision is enhanced, granting you bonuses on ranged attacks against targets at least 20 feet away. While you are in bright light, you gain +1 to attack and damage rolls.
While in dim light, you gain +1 to attack rolls.
At the end of the duration, the tattoo returns to your scalp.

item.name: Lifewell Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo comprises symbols of life and rebirth.}
Whenever you are dying at the start of your turn, ink sweeps over your wounds, instantly stabilizing you.
In addition, whenever you roll a Hit Die to regain hit points, ink stitches across your injuries, doubling the hit points you receive.

item.name: Mooring Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo's ink feels supernaturally heavy beneath the skin.}
You have advantage on ability checks and saving throws to avoid being moved or knocked prone.

entries.name: Anchor.
entries: As a bonus action, you can empower the tattoo. While empowered, you cannot use your movement, and you cannot be moved even if you are defying gravity.
A creature can use an action to make a DC 30 Strength check, moving you up to 10 feet on a success.

item.name: Veil Tattoo
entries: {@note This tattoo shimmers on the skin, some parts of it appearing blurred.}
When you make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check to steal something in view of creatures that rely on sight, you roll with advantage.

entries.name: Blur.
entries: As an action, you can use the tattoo to cast {@spell Blur}.
Once the spell is cast from the tattoo, it can’t be cast from the tattoo again until the next dawn.

item.name: Angel Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note Angel tattoos harness divine magic and confer it on their owners. The powers of the tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Celestial Sense.
entries: You may cast {@spell Detect Evil and Good|PHB} without using a spell slot. You must complete a short rest before using this ability again.

item.name: Bear Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a bear tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Bear Stamina.
entries: You have advantage on Constitution saving throws.

item.name: Chameleon Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a chameleon tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Sticky Feet.
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

item.name: Cobra Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a cobra tattoo are determined by its rarity.The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Cobra Strike.
entries: You gain the ability to strike with the speed and precision of a cobra. You may use a bonus action to give yourself advantage on your next melee attack roll. The attack must take place in the same round. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, after which you must finish a short or long rest before using it again.

item.name: Dragon Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note Dragon tattoos tap into the magic of themythical beasts. The powers of the tattoo aredetermined by its rarity and the colour of the ink, and rarer tattoos feature all the powers of less rare tattoos (with the exception that Twinned Draconic Strikes replaces Draconic Strikes).}

entries.name: Draconic Strikes.
entries: You deal an additional 1d4 damage, of the type associated with your depicted dragon, on all one-handed weapon and unarmed strikes made with the limb upon which your tattoo is drawn, as well as on any two-handed weapon attacks. These attack are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

item.name: Eagle Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of an eagle tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Swoop of the Eagle.
entries: When you move at least 20 feet in a straight line towards an opponent, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against that target.

item.name: Kingfisher Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a kingfisher tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Darting Attack.
entries: When you move at least 10 feet in a straight line before hitting a creature with a melee attack, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of your turn.

item.name: Mermaid Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a mermaid tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Merfolk Form.
entries: As a bonus action, you can change the shape of your lower body, and anything worn or attached to it, to that of a large piscine tail. You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet when in your new form. You may revert back to your original form by using an action.

item.name: Monkey Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of the monkey tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Monkey Agility.
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

item.name: Owl Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of an owl tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Owl Shape.
entries: As an action you may transform into an {@creature Owl|MM} or a {@creature Giant Owl|MM}. You may talk while in animal shape and cast spells that don't require somatic or material components, otherwise this feature is governed by the same rules as the druid's Wild Shape ability. You may stay in owl form for as long as you wish, reverting to your normal form by spending an action. Once you've reverted back to your normal form, you cannot use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

item.name: Panther Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a panther tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Nocturnal Hunter.
entries: You gain darkvision to a range of 60 feet (if you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet), and you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in dim light or darkness.

item.name: Phoenix Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a phoenix tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Fortune of the Phoenix.
entries: If you fail a saving throw, you can choose to retake it with advantage. Once used, you must finish a long rest before using this ability again.

item.name: Tiger Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a tiger tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Eye of the Tiger.
entries: You develop the eye of the hunter and with it a will of steel. You gain darkvision to a range of 60 feet (if you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet), and you become proficient in your choice of either Charisma or Wisdom saving throws.

item.name: Unicorn Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a unicorn tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Fey Spirit.
entries: You gain advantage on saving throws against being charmed, paralysed or poisoned.

item.name: Wolf Tattoo (uncommon)
entries: {@note The powers of a wolf tattoo are determined by its rarity. The rarer tattoos feature all the powers of the less rare tattoos.}

entries.name: Wild Nature
entries: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: Nature, Perception or Survival, as well as one of your choice of Wisdom or Constitution saving throws.

item.name: spectral dagger +1
entries: {@note These daggers are aquired by using the {@item Knifedancer Tattoo|InkmagusReEditedAnna}.}
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this dagger, if you throw the daggers they return to your hands at the end of your turn.

item.name: arcane needle
entries: {@note This item is aquired by getting the {@classFeature Steel Stinger|InkmagusReEditedAnna} Artist Subclass feature}
This needle floats around you until you order it to attack.
You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this needle and the damage die is determined by your luck die level as shown below:

item.name: Inking Supplies
additionalEntries: Tattooist’s tools allow one creature to tattoo the epidermal layer (skin, scales, fur, feathers, etc.) of themselves or another creature. Proficiency in these tools increases the odds of a tattoo appearing as intended.

additionalEntries.name: Components
entries: Tattooist’s tools consist of small, sharpened, animal bones, pigments derived from plants and insects, {@item Ink (1-ounce bottle)|PHB}, 10 feet of {@item Hempen Rope (50 feet)|PHB|hempen rope}, and a {@item Healer's Kit|PHB}.

additionalEntries.name: Skills
entries: If you are proficient in tattooist’s tools, you can use them (with your DM’s permission) to gain advantage on the following skill checks under certain circumstances relevant to tattoos. Each skill listed has a general description meant to inspire you using these tools in this way.

items: {@b Arcana.} Proficiency in tattooist’s tools can help you determine a magical tattoo or marking’s properties If you have proficiency in the Arcana skill along with tattooist’s tools. you can also give the help action to anyone making the check even if you don't have proficiency
{@b History.} Though tattooist’s tools cannot help translate or decipher language, proficiency in them can assist you in learning the age and origin of a tattoo.

{@b Insight/Investigation.} A creature’s tattoos say a lot about them. When seeing a tattoo on a creature, proficiency in tattooist’s tools can help you more easily learn the meanings behind certain symbols, creatures, or other commonly used markings in tattoos.

feat.name: Ankle Wings
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a set of wings on your ankles.}

items: Your base walking speed is increased by 10 feet.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell Expeditious Retreat|PHB} spell targeting yourself at will.

feat.name: Armour of the Tortoise
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a tortoise shell}

items: While you are not wearing armour, your AC is equal to 13 + your Dexterity modifier.

feat.name: Beast Tongue
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a triangle of three dots on your tongue.}

items: You have advantage on Charisma checks made to interact with beasts of size Medium or larger.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell Speak with Animals|PHB} spell at will

feat.name: Eyes of Night
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles two open eyes tattooed on your eyelids.}

items: You can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical to a distance of 120 feet.

feat.name: Eyes of the Otherworld
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles an open eye over your heart.}

items: You gain proficiency in the Insight skill if you did not already have it.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell Detect Evil and Good|PHB} spell at will

feat.name: Eyes of the Weave
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles two open eyes on the backs of yourhands.}

items: You gain proficiency in the Arcana skill if you did not already have it.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell Detect Magic|PHB} spell at will

feat.name: Eyes of the Word
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles an open eye on each palm.}

items: You learn one additional language of your choice.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast {@spell Comprehend Languages|PHB} at will

feat.name: Forest Print
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles the dappled greens and browns of a natural forest.}

items: You can hide even while only lightly obscured by leaves, grass, or other plant-based barriers.

Once you reach 5th level if you are heavily obscured from all hostile creatures by leaves, grass, or other natural barriers, you can use a bonus action to become invisible. This invisibility lasts until you move, take an action, or take a reaction

feat.name: Keepsafe
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a small circle outlined in dotted lines on your dominant wrist.}

As an action while you are holding an object which is no more than 5 feet long in any dimension, weighs less than 20 pounds, and is not held by anyone else, you can invoke this tattoo to store that object in an extradimensional space.
An image of the object appears in the bounded area of the tattoo.
As a bonus action, you can invoke this tattoo again to cause the object stored in the extradimensional space to appear in your hand.

Alternatively, you can use a bonus action to dismiss the object stored in the extradimensional space, in which case it appears in a random location in the Astral Sea, and the extradimensional space is now empty.
You can only store a maximum of one object in the extradimensional space at any one time

feat.name: Pierced Vigour
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a heart pierced through by a sword blade.}

items: Whenever you would gain temporary hit points, gain that number of temporary hit points + 1.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell False Life|PHB} spell at 1st level at will without material components

feat.name: Sight Thief
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles an abstract pattern of dots on your temples.}

As an action, you can invoke this tattoo and touch a creature to attempt to see through its senses. An unwilling creature can attempt an Intelligence saving throw. Creatures with an Intelligence score less than or equal to your proficiency bonus automatically fail their saving throw.
On a successful save, a creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
While you are seeing through a creature's senses, you are blind and deaf to your own surroundings.

While you are seeing through the senses of a creature with an Intelligence less than or equal to your profiency bonus, you can also control that creature for as long as you see through its senses. You can't force a creature to attack or to enter a dangerous situation if it would not do so naturally

feat.name: The Faceless
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a humanoid face, but each time you look at it the face is subtley different.}

items: You gain proficiency with the Deception skill, if you do not already have it.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast the {@spell Disguise Self|PHB} spell at will

feat.name: Wakefulness
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a head with flowers growing out of it.}

items: You no longer need to sleep, and you gain the benefits of a long rest from spending 8 hours doing only light activity, such as keeping watch or reading a book.

As an action, you can invoke this tattoo to immediately awaken every creature that is in a nonmagical sleep within 30 feet of you. For each creature within 30 feet of you that is in a magical sleep, make an Intelligence check. The DC for this check is equal to the DC of the magical effect, 10 + the level of the spell (if it is a spell which does not have a DC), or an appropriate DC determined by the DM if it neither has a DC nor is a spell On a successful check, that creature wakens from that magical sleep.

feat.name: White Feather
entries: {@note This tattoo resembles a white feather caught in the breeze.}

items: When calculating the damage you take from falling, reduce the distance you fell by 10 feet for that calculation.
You can invoke this tattoo to cast {@spell Feather Fall|PHB} at will
